Return only the one-paragraph video description without Markdown formatting or introductory text.

First, specify the **shot size** based on the subject's size in the frame if major subjects are present. If the shot size is unclear, describe how much of the subject is visible. If no major subject exists (e.g., a scenery shot), describe the shot size in relation to the scenery.

Next, describe the **spatial position of subjects and elements in the video**, if relevant. If **shot size or spatial position** changes, describe how these transitions occur clearly, specifying both the **initial and final states**.

The man in the middleground has a concentrated expression with his mouth slightly open.**
Human-Written Description for Scenery: **The scene takes place outdoors during the day, with a large, textured tree trunk and green foliage forming the background. A rectangular graham cracker is thrown by a man wearing a red baseball cap and a maroon t-shirt with white lettering. After throwing the cracker, the first man stands still in the foreground. A red-backed playing card, thrown by a second man, travels from the background towards the foreground and strikes the cracker, causing it to shatter into fragments.**
